term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - centre of a Mossbauer spectrum
term.title: centre

item.text: The centre of a Mössbauer spectrum is defined as the Doppler-velocity at which the resonance maximum is (or would be) observed when all magnetic dipole, electric quadrupole, etc. hyperfine interactions are (or would be) absent. The contribution of the second order Doppler shift (δ T) should be indicated, if possible.

sources.item: PAC, 1976, 45, 211. 'Nomenclature and Conventions for Reporting Mössbauer Spectroscopic Data' on page 215 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac197645030211)
